::: {.content_mcptgg__MGAfu test-id="templates/individual/content" style="overflow-wrap:break-word"}
## Block Bad Bots Firewall Rule {#block-bad-bots-firewall-rule-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

A firewall rule that identifies bots that you might not want requesting
your projects.

The rule defaults to the \"log action\". Set to \"Deny\" to actually
block these bots.

### Consider customization {#consider-customization .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

The generated firewall rule blocks a multitude of bots. Consider
customizing the list to your need.

## Block Bad Bots Firewall Rule {#block-bad-bots-firewall-rule-3 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

A firewall rule that identifies bots that you might not want requesting
your projects.

The rule defaults to the \"log action\". Set to \"Deny\" to actually
block these bots.

### Consider customization {#consider-customization-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

The generated firewall rule blocks a multitude of bots. Consider
customizing the list to your need.

### Attribution {#attribution-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This template is based on the [Nginx Bad Bot
Blocker](https://github.com/mitchellkrogza/nginx-ultimate-bad-bot-blocker){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
project.

## Block OFAC-Sanctioned Countries and Regions {#block-ofac-sanctioned-countries-and-regions .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This template provides a preset, customizable Vercel Firewall rule which
is designed to support your compliance with US export control
regulations by offering the ability to restrict access from sanctioned
and embargoed regions.

### Overview {#overview .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Identify incoming requests based on their country of origin and block
access from specified OFAC-sanctioned countries and regions. The list is
not meant to be exhaustive, and may not include all sanctioned countries
and regions as of any given date. Updating and customizing the list of
countries and regions, ensuring that the firewall rule is operating as
intended, and otherwise maintaining the compliance of your product and
operations remains your responsibility.

### Consider customization {#consider-customization .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

The generated Firewall rule provides a basic structure for blocking
traffic from countries and regions sanctioned by the Office of Foreign
Assets Control (OFAC). Consider customizing the following parameters to
suit your specific compliance needs:

1.  **Country List**: Update the list of countries to be blocked based
    on the latest government sanctions program or any countries you
    desire to add.
2.  **Region List**: Use the Country and State keys together to block
    specific regions or subdivisions in ISO 3166-2 format (e.g., UA-43
    for Crimea). This allows for more granular control than
    country-level blocking. Note: Country and State correspond to the
    `X-Vercel-IP-Country`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
    data-version="v1"} and
    `X-Vercel-IP-Country-Region`{.inline_code__cgX1y
    geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} headers, respectively.
3.  **Exception Handling**: Configure exceptions for specific IP
    addresses or entities that require access despite country
    restrictions.

### Persistent Action {#persistent-action .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

The rule includes a persistent action set to a duration of 1 hour. Any
requests blocked due to persistent actions, which are activated after
the first violation of the rule, are blocked before any usage is
incurred.

### Availability {#availability .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This solution can be implemented by users on all plans.

### To Use {#to-use .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

To use this template, follow these steps:

1.  Click \"Add Firewall Rule.\"
2.  Select your team and project.
3.  Configure the rule to block traffic from countries and regions
    sanctioned by the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) as
    necessary.
4.  Don\'t forget to hit \"Save,\" and then \"Publish\" to activate the
    rule.
:::

## Add Header Example {#add-header-example .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Below is the code from
[middleware.ts](https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}
showing how to add response headers at the edge:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server'

export default function middleware() {
  // Store the response so we can modify its headers
  const response = NextResponse.next()

  // Set custom header
  response.headers.set('x-modified-edge', 'true')

  // Return response
  return response
}
```

### Demo {#demo .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://edge-functions-add-header.vercel.app](https://edge-functions-add-header.vercel.app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=vercel-examples){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/edge-middleware/add-header&project-name=add-header&repository-name=add-header){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/edge-middleware/add-header add-header
```

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

## Add Header Example {#add-header-example-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Below is the code from
[middleware.ts](https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}
showing how to add response headers at the edge:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server'

export default function middleware() {
  // Store the response so we can modify its headers
  const response = NextResponse.next()

  // Set custom header
  response.headers.set('x-modified-edge', 'true')

  // Return response
  return response
}
```

### Demo {#demo-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://edge-functions-add-header.vercel.app](https://edge-functions-add-header.vercel.app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=vercel-examples){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/edge-middleware/add-header&project-name=add-header&repository-name=add-header){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/edge-middleware/add-header add-header
```

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Deploy it to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=edge-middleware-eap){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).

## Add Header Example {#add-header-example .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Below is the code from
[middleware.ts](https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}
showing how to add/update/delete headers in a middleware (available
since Next.js v13.0.0):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
import { NextResponse } from 'next/server'
import type { NextRequest } from 'next/server'

export default function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  // Clone the request headers
  // You can modify them with headers API: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers
  const requestHeaders = new Headers(request.headers)

  // Add new request headers
  requestHeaders.set('x-hello-from-middleware1', 'hello')
  requestHeaders.set('x-hello-from-middleware2', 'world!')

  // Update an existing request header
  requestHeaders.set('user-agent', 'New User Agent overriden by middleware!')

  // Delete an existing request header
  requestHeaders.delete('x-from-client')

  // You can also set request headers in NextResponse.rewrite
  return NextResponse.next({
    request: {
      // New request headers
      headers: requestHeaders,
    },
  })
}
```

# []{#vercel-functions .linked-heading_target__xscdv .linked-heading_offsetTop__uAoyO}[Vercel Functions]{.linked-heading_title__mCMLh .[&>p]:m-0} {#vercel-functions .text_wrapper__i87JK .linked-heading_header__YpMmf .headings_heading__DRlSP data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2.5rem;--text-line-height:3.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.058125rem;--text-weight:600" components-heading="true"}

::::::::::::::::::: {.[&_[data-geist-note]_p]:my-0 .[&_code_p]:my-0 .[&_code_p]:contents .[&_p]:leading-[1.6] .[&_ol]:p-0 .[&_ol]:pl-4 .[&_ol]:list-decimal .[&_ol]:ml-3.5 .[&_[class*='container']_p]:m-0}
Vercel Functions lets you run server-side code without managing servers.
They adapt automatically to user demand, handle connections to APIs and
databases, and offer enhanced concurrency through [fluid
compute](/docs/functions/fluid-compute){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_blend__JjXMT zone="same"}, which is useful for AI workloads or any
[I/O-bound[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.ml-1}]{.link_disabled__XCKN4
.link_highlight__kJZF9 state="closed" zone="same" aria-disabled="true"
role="link" tabindex="-1"} tasks that require efficient scaling

When you deploy your application, Vercel automatically sets up the tools
and optimizations for your chosen
[framework](/docs/frameworks){.link_link__hbWKh .link_blend__JjXMT
zone="same"}. It ensures low latency by routing traffic through
Vercel\'s [Edge Network](/docs/edge-network){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_blend__JjXMT zone="same"}, and placing your functions in a
specific region when you need more control over [data
locality](/docs/functions#functions-and-your-data-source){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_blend__JjXMT zone="same"}.

## []{#functions-lifecycle .linked-heading_target__xscdv .linked-heading_offsetTop__uAoyO}[Functions lifecycle](#functions-lifecycle){.linked-heading_title__mCMLh .[&>p]:m-0}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,){.text-[0.6em]}]{.linked-heading_permalink__pJ_q_} {#functions-lifecycle .text_wrapper__i87JK .linked-heading_header__YpMmf .headings_heading__DRlSP data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600" components-heading="true"}
:::

Vercel Functions run in a single
[region](/docs/functions/configuring-functions/region){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_blend__JjXMT zone="same"} by default, although you can configure
them to run in multiple regions if you have globally replicated data.
These functions let you add extra capabilities to your application, such
as handling authentication, streaming data, or querying databases.

When a user sends a request to your site, Vercel can automatically run a
function based on your application code. You do not need to manage
servers, or handle scaling.

Vercel creates a new function invocation for each incoming request. If
another request arrives soon after the previous one, Vercel [reuses the
same
function](/docs/functions/fluid-compute#optimized-concurrency){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_blend__JjXMT zone="same"} instance to optimize performance and
cost efficiency. Over time, Vercel only keeps as many active functions
as needed to handle your traffic. Vercel scales your functions down to
zero when there are no incoming requests.

By allowing concurrent execution within the same instance (and so using
idle time for compute), fluid compute reduces cold starts, lowers
latency, and saves on compute costs. It also prevents the need to spin
up multiple isolated instances when tasks spend most of their time
waiting for external operations.

::: linked-heading_container__iwdxj
### []{#functions-and-your-data-source .linked-heading_target__xscdv .linked-heading_offsetTop__uAoyO}[Functions and your data source](#functions-and-your-data-source){.linked-heading_title__mCMLh .[&>p]:m-0}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,){.text-[0.6em]}]{.linked-heading_permalink__pJ_q_} {#functions-and-your-data-source .text_wrapper__i87JK .linked-heading_header__YpMmf .headings_heading__DRlSP data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600" components-heading="true"}
:::

[Functions]{.strong_docsString__rhKq5} should always execute close to
where your data source is to reduce latency. By default, functions using
the Node.js runtime execute in Washington, D.C., USA
(`iad1`{.code_code__TTx9V .code_inlineCode__DZHMn}), a common location
for external data sources. You can set a new region through your
[project\'s settings on
Vercel](/docs/functions/configuring-functions/region#setting-your-default-region){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_blend__JjXMT zone="same"}.

::: linked-heading_container__iwdxj
## []{#viewing-vercel-function-metrics .linked-heading_target__xscdv .linked-heading_offsetTop__uAoyO}[Viewing Vercel Function metrics](#viewing-vercel-function-metrics){.linked-heading_title__mCMLh .[&>p]:m-0}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,){.text-[0.6em]}]{.linked-heading_permalink__pJ_q_} {#viewing-vercel-function-metrics .text_wrapper__i87JK .linked-heading_header__YpMmf .headings_heading__DRlSP data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600" components-heading="true"}
:::

You can view various performance and cost efficiency metrics using
Vercel Observability:

1.  Choose your project from the
    [dashboard](https://vercel.com/d?to=%2F%5Bteam%5D%2F%5Bproject%5D&title=Go+to+dashboard){.link_link__hbWKh
    .link_blend__JjXMT rel="noopener" target="_blank" zone="null"}.
2.  Click on the [Observability]{.strong_docsString__rhKq5} tab and
    select the [Vercel Functions]{.strong_docsString__rhKq5} section.
3.  Click on the chevron icon to expand and see all charts.

From here, you\'ll be able to see total consumed and saved GB-Hours, and
the ratio of the saved usage. When you have
[fluid](/docs/functions/fluid-compute){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_blend__JjXMT zone="same"} enabled, you will also see the amount of
cost savings from the [optimized concurrency
model](/docs/functions/fluid-compute#optimized-concurrency){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_blend__JjXMT zone="same"}.

::: linked-heading_container__iwdxj

## []{#personalization-vs.-speed-every-millisecond-matters .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Personalization vs. speed: every millisecond matters](#personalization-vs.-speed-every-millisecond-matters){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#personalization-vs.-speed-every-millisecond-matters .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

As online businesses know, a delay in page load between adding to cart
and clicking "check out" can equal thousands in lost revenue. However,
personalization matters too---if not more---in today's global market.Â 

This is one of the key challenges facing developers today: What's the
best way to render a page, when you're juggling the tradeoff between
speed and personalization?Â 

Developers, and your business, shouldn't have to choose. With flexible
frameworks like Next.js and solutions like Vercel Edge Middleware, you
can reduce those trade-offs and get the freedom to choose the method
that works best for you and your users.

In this brief, we're going to explain how Edge Middleware works, and
have a look at ways that it can help teams deliver fast and dynamic
experiences---all while maintaining an exceptional developer experience.

## []{#how-does-middleware-work- .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[How does middleware work?](#how-does-middleware-work-){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5} [![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#how-does-middleware-work .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

Middleware is another part of your application---it's code that executes
before a request is processed on a site. That code will typically
process or modify the response by rewriting and redirecting.

As the request is made to the server, middleware will intercept, and
send back the correct page elements (for example: where someone is
located or whether they\'re logged in).

With middleware, decisions get made on the server side, not in the
browser.

In short, middleware:Â 

- Tells the server which page to return, based on the user requesting it
- Runs before the page is loaded, and returns page based on the answer
- Lives between the code and the data center

## []{#seamless-configuration-with-your-application .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Seamless configuration with your application](#seamless-configuration-with-your-application){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#seamless-configuration-with-your-application .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

From automatic configuration to personalization, Edge Middleware on
Vercel creates a top experience for devs and users alike. Here are some
of the features:

### []{#vercel-automatically-configures-edge-middleware .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Vercel automatically configures Edge Middleware](#vercel-automatically-configures-edge-middleware){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#vercel-automatically-configures-edge-middleware .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Next.js gives developers the ability to implement middleware in their
applications. On Vercel, middleware gets automatically configured on our
global Edge Network, ensuring global performance out of the box, and
working in perfect harmony with the static or traditional serverless
pieces of your application.

### []{#zero-configuration-on-any-framework- .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Zero configuration on any frameworkÂ ](#zero-configuration-on-any-framework-){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#zero-configuration-on-any-framework .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Using Edge Middleware on Vercel allows developers to avoid lengthy
configuration files. Instead, you can define routing rules (like
rewrites, redirects, and headers) with code. In fact, you can define the
entire global infrastructure of your application from code, no matter
what framework you choose to build with.

### []{#personalized-cached-content .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Personalized cached content](#personalized-cached-content){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#personalized-cached-content .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Middleware on Vercel runs before the cache, giving it the ability to
quickly route and rewrite requests to return pre-rendered pages.
Developers can ship multiple versions of the same pre-built static site,
and fetch the correct version---configured entirely by your custom
code.Â 

### []{#instant-code-execution .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Instant code execution](#instant-code-execution){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#instant-code-execution .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Edge Middleware has no cold boots and 100x faster startups than Node.js
on containers or virtual machines. It can check for and serve the right
page instantly. This is why we say \"dynamic at the speed of static."

## []{#use-cases .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Use cases](#use-cases){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#use-cases .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

Your users expect a fast, personalized, and secure experience. Let's
dive into some of the ways you can make this happen with Edge Middleware
on Vercel.Â 

### []{#a/b-testing-and-feature-flags .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[A/B testing and feature flags](#a/b-testing-and-feature-flags){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#ab-testing-and-feature-flags .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Teams are constantly looking to glean insights about their users. Vercel
Edge Middleware creates a highly personalized test without disrupting
users' experience on your site. Additionally, it can help with feature
flags, giving you the ability to deploy instantly when you build a site
behind one.Â 

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Without Edge Middleware                                                                                                                          With Edge Middleware
  Flash incorrect versions of the page to the user, before going to the correct variation---known as the "flicker effect."                         Make decisions on the server-side instead of the browser, so the control version never shows.
  Build features from behind feature flags, resulting in deployment delays. Different versions of sites run in the background, creating latency.   Deploy instantly when building behind a feature flag. New features load correctly even with a different version running in the background.
  Execute code on the client side through third-party scripts, adding bloat and often impacting performance.                                       Eliminate need for third-party scripts, reducing the amount of code sent to the client, and leveling up site performance.
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### []{#[object-object] .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[*SumUp ships personalized A/B tests at the edge*](#%5Bobject-object%5D){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#sumup-ships-personalized-ab-tests-at-the-edge .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

*SumUp is a UK-based fintech company that makes card readers and
processes payments for over 3.5 million merchants and small businesses
worldwide.Â *

*They use Vercel Edge Middleware to personalize content at the edge, for
custom experimentation, and A/B testing.*

*Here's how it works: if SumUp's site visitor is part of the split test,
they'll be routed from the edge server to one of the possible variants.
The URL is rewritten accordingly to show the appropriate page to each
user---and this all happens instantaneously, on the server-side. They
don't need to load heavy client-side libraries for personalization or
deal with layout shift from validating whether the visitor was part of
the current experiment or not. The user sees only what they are meant to
see, instantly.Â *

### []{#security .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Security](#security){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#security .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Bots. Authentication. Secure sign-in and passwords. The list of security
considerations can seem endless, and teams are faced with more
requirements and resources than ever before. To top it off, security
provisions are intrinsically high stakes. Vercel Edge Middleware can
ease this burden, giving your users an experience that is both secure
and fast.

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Without Edge Middleware                                                                        With Edge Middleware
  Unauthorized content flickers, because authentication is not immediately prompted.             Show paywall or authorized page versions instantly, with no delay or glimpse of unauthorized content.
  Bots flood websites during big drops and purchase products before real users get the chance.   Intercept requests with bot protection middleware, to determine whether it â€¨came from a bot. If determined to be malicious, the request is refused.
  Secure sign-on is cumbersome and creates delays for the user.                                  Sign-ons are quick, secure, and handled by Edge Middleware.
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### []{#[object-object] .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[*Clerk authenticates in under one millisecond using Edge Middleware*](#%5Bobject-object%5D){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#clerk-authenticates-in-under-one-millisecond-using-edge-middleware .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

*Clerk is an authentication plugin that runs on Edge Middleware. They
use a hybrid JWT approach (JSON web token), which allows them to
authenticate requests in under one millisecond, but still revoke
sessions in under one minute during security emergencies. Their
security-conscious customers also enjoy speed benefits of the edge. With
Clerk on Edge Middleware, users can safely authenticate requests without
contacting an origin server, so authentication hasÂ  no practical impact
on their time-to-first-byte.*

### []{#geolocation .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Geolocation](#geolocation){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#geolocation .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

images on social media to discerning location for content localization,
including language, currency unit, and cultural context. When you
geolocate and localize on the edge, you enjoy less client-side code,
reduced flicker, and it's easier to manage different versions of your
site.

  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Without Edge Middleware                                                                                                           With Edge Middleware
  Display incorrect currencies, languages, and more--all with long page load times.                                                 Localize experiences seamlessly, so users around the world can experience content most relevant to them.
  Run content through a geolocation service to ensure proper localization, putting a financial and workload burden on developers.   Geolocate requests automatically, so developers don't need to manage or â€¨pay for a geolocation service.
  Sell services locally, but experience difficulty competing in international markets.                                              Serve local content accurately and instantly, which allows companies anywhere, of any size to be global.
  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## []{#the-future-of-frontend .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[The future of frontend](#the-future-of-frontend){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#the-future-of-frontend .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

We believe that the future of frontend lives at the edge.

Edge Middleware brings leading technology directly into your workflow.
You can configure complex global infrastructure and routing without
leaving your application. It\'s smaller (less application bloat), faster
(starts up and returns quickly), and performs better (more easily
indexed for better SEO).Â 

Subsequently, you're empowered to build sites that achieve a better user
and developer experience, giving you the ultimate competitive advantage.

## []{#personalization-vs.-speed-every-millisecond-matters .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Personalization vs. speed: every millisecond matters](#personalization-vs.-speed-every-millisecond-matters){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#personalization-vs.-speed-every-millisecond-matters .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

As online businesses know, a delay in page load between adding to cart
and clicking "check out" can equal thousands in lost revenue. However,
personalization matters too---if not more---in today's global market.Â 

This is one of the key challenges facing developers today: What's the
best way to render a page, when you're juggling the tradeoff between
speed and personalization?Â 

Developers, and your business, shouldn't have to choose. With flexible
frameworks like Next.js and solutions like Vercel Edge Middleware, you
can reduce those trade-offs and get the freedom to choose the method
that works best for you and your users.

In this brief, we're going to explain how Edge Middleware works, and
have a look at ways that it can help teams deliver fast and dynamic
experiences---all while maintaining an exceptional developer experience.

## []{#how-does-middleware-work- .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[How does middleware work?](#how-does-middleware-work-){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5} [![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#how-does-middleware-work .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

Middleware is another part of your application---it's code that executes
before a request is processed on a site. That code will typically
process or modify the response by rewriting and redirecting.

As the request is made to the server, middleware will intercept, and
send back the correct page elements (for example: where someone is
located or whether they\'re logged in).

With middleware, decisions get made on the server side, not in the
browser.

In short, middleware:Â 

- Tells the server which page to return, based on the user requesting it
- Runs before the page is loaded, and returns page based on the answer
- Lives between the code and the data center

## []{#seamless-configuration-with-your-application .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Seamless configuration with your application](#seamless-configuration-with-your-application){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#seamless-configuration-with-your-application .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

From automatic configuration to personalization, Edge Middleware on
Vercel creates a top experience for devs and users alike. Here are some
of the features:

### []{#vercel-automatically-configures-edge-middleware .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Vercel automatically configures Edge Middleware](#vercel-automatically-configures-edge-middleware){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#vercel-automatically-configures-edge-middleware .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Next.js gives developers the ability to implement middleware in their
applications. On Vercel, middleware gets automatically configured on our
global Edge Network, ensuring global performance out of the box, and
working in perfect harmony with the static or traditional serverless
pieces of your application.

### []{#zero-configuration-on-any-framework- .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Zero configuration on any frameworkÂ ](#zero-configuration-on-any-framework-){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#zero-configuration-on-any-framework .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Using Edge Middleware on Vercel allows developers to avoid lengthy
configuration files. Instead, you can define routing rules (like
rewrites, redirects, and headers) with code. In fact, you can define the
entire global infrastructure of your application from code, no matter
what framework you choose to build with.

### []{#personalized-cached-content .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Personalized cached content](#personalized-cached-content){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#personalized-cached-content .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Middleware on Vercel runs before the cache, giving it the ability to
quickly route and rewrite requests to return pre-rendered pages.
Developers can ship multiple versions of the same pre-built static site,
and fetch the correct version---configured entirely by your custom
code.Â 

### []{#instant-code-execution .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Instant code execution](#instant-code-execution){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#instant-code-execution .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Edge Middleware has no cold boots and 100x faster startups than Node.js
on containers or virtual machines. It can check for and serve the right
page instantly. This is why we say \"dynamic at the speed of static."

## []{#use-cases .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Use cases](#use-cases){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#use-cases .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

Your users expect a fast, personalized, and secure experience. Let's
dive into some of the ways you can make this happen with Edge Middleware
on Vercel.Â 

### []{#a/b-testing-and-feature-flags .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[A/B testing and feature flags](#a/b-testing-and-feature-flags){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#ab-testing-and-feature-flags .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Teams are constantly looking to glean insights about their users. Vercel
Edge Middleware creates a highly personalized test without disrupting
users' experience on your site. Additionally, it can help with feature
flags, giving you the ability to deploy instantly when you build a site
behind one.Â 

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Without Edge Middleware                                                                                                                          With Edge Middleware
  Flash incorrect versions of the page to the user, before going to the correct variation---known as the "flicker effect."                         Make decisions on the server-side instead of the browser, so the control version never shows.
  Build features from behind feature flags, resulting in deployment delays. Different versions of sites run in the background, creating latency.   Deploy instantly when building behind a feature flag. New features load correctly even with a different version running in the background.
  Execute code on the client side through third-party scripts, adding bloat and often impacting performance.                                       Eliminate need for third-party scripts, reducing the amount of code sent to the client, and leveling up site performance.
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### []{#[object-object] .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[*SumUp ships personalized A/B tests at the edge*](#%5Bobject-object%5D){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#sumup-ships-personalized-ab-tests-at-the-edge .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

*SumUp is a UK-based fintech company that makes card readers and
processes payments for over 3.5 million merchants and small businesses
worldwide.Â *

*They use Vercel Edge Middleware to personalize content at the edge, for
custom experimentation, and A/B testing.*

*Here's how it works: if SumUp's site visitor is part of the split test,
they'll be routed from the edge server to one of the possible variants.
The URL is rewritten accordingly to show the appropriate page to each
user---and this all happens instantaneously, on the server-side. They
don't need to load heavy client-side libraries for personalization or
deal with layout shift from validating whether the visitor was part of
the current experiment or not. The user sees only what they are meant to
see, instantly.Â *

### []{#security .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[Security](#security){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#security .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

Bots. Authentication. Secure sign-in and passwords. The list of security
considerations can seem endless, and teams are faced with more
requirements and resources than ever before. To top it off, security
provisions are intrinsically high stakes. Vercel Edge Middleware can
ease this burden, giving your users an experience that is both secure
and fast.

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Without Edge Middleware                                                                        With Edge Middleware
  Unauthorized content flickers, because authentication is not immediately prompted.             Show paywall or authorized page versions instantly, with no delay or glimpse of unauthorized content.
  Bots flood websites during big drops and purchase products before real users get the chance.   Intercept requests with bot protection middleware, to determine whether it â€¨came from a bot. If determined to be malicious, the request is refused.
  Secure sign-on is cumbersome and creates delays for the user.                                  Sign-ons are quick, secure, and handled by Edge Middleware.
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### []{#[object-object] .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[*Clerk authenticates in under one millisecond using Edge Middleware*](#%5Bobject-object%5D){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#clerk-authenticates-in-under-one-millisecond-using-edge-middleware .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-8 .text-xl .leading-6 .tracking-[-0.01rem] .lg:text-2xl .lg:leading-8 .lg:mt-9 .heading3}

*Clerk is an authentication plugin that runs on Edge Middleware. They
use a hybrid JWT approach (JSON web token), which allows them to
authenticate requests in under one millisecond, but still revoke
sessions in under one minute during security emergencies. Their
security-conscious customers also enjoy speed benefits of the edge. With
Clerk on Edge Middleware, users can safely authenticate requests without
contacting an origin server, so authentication hasÂ  no practical impact
on their time-to-first-byte.*

## []{#the-future-of-frontend .block .-mt-5 .pt-5 .invisible .absolute}[The future of frontend](#the-future-of-frontend){.border-b .border-transparent .text-inherit .no-underline .hover:border-b-current .inline-block .lg:mr-2.5}[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.text-center .align-middle .border .invisible .hidden .lg:inline-block .group-hover-visible} {#the-future-of-frontend .group .flex .items-baseline .mt-[52px] .mb-6 .tracking-[-0.03rem] .leading-7 .lg:mt-[60px] .lg:text-[2rem] .lg:leading-9 .heading2}

We believe that the future of frontend lives at the edge.

Edge Middleware brings leading technology directly into your workflow.
You can configure complex global infrastructure and routing without
leaving your application. It\'s smaller (less application bloat), faster
(starts up and returns quickly), and performs better (more easily
indexed for better SEO).Â 

Subsequently, you're empowered to build sites that achieve a better user
and developer experience, giving you the ultimate competitive advantage.

Create personalized content at the speed of static sites.

Self-serve advanced routing requirements.

Couple dynamism and caching.

Give your customers unmatched UX.

All within your framework.Â

::: {.content_mcptgg__MGAfu test-id="templates/individual/content" style="overflow-wrap:break-word"}
## IP Blocking with DataDome {#ip-blocking-with-datadome-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[DataDome](https://datadome.co/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} can
provide real-time bot protection, ip blocking, custom rules protection
and other security protections to any website.

This demo shows features:

- IP Blocking
- Protection through Custom Rules

### Demo {#demo .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://edge-functions-ip-blocking-datadome.vercel.app](https://edge-functions-ip-blocking-datadome.vercel.app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel-customer-feedback%2Fedge-middleware%2Ftree%2Fmain%2Fexamples%2Fip-blocking-datadome&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_DATADOME_CLIENT_KEY,DATADOME_SERVER_KEY,DATADOME_MANAGEMENT_KEY&project-name=ip-blocking-datadome&repository-name=ip-blocking-datadome){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/edge-middleware/ab-testing-simple ab-testing-simple
```

You\'ll need to have an account with
[DataDome](https://datadome.co/free-signup/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}. Once
that\'s done, copy the `.env.example`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} file in this directory to
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
(which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.example .env.local
```

Then open `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} and set the environment variables to match the ones
in your DataDome dashboard. Your keys should be available at
[https://app.datadome.co/dashboard/config/protection/keys](https://app.datadome.co/dashboard/config/protection/keys){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Deploy it to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=edge-middleware-eap){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).
:::

## IP Blocking with DataDome {#ip-blocking-with-datadome-3 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[DataDome](https://datadome.co/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} can
provide real-time bot protection, ip blocking, custom rules protection
and other security protections to any website.

This demo shows features:

- IP Blocking
- Protection through Custom Rules

### Demo {#demo-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://edge-functions-ip-blocking-datadome.vercel.app](https://edge-functions-ip-blocking-datadome.vercel.app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel-customer-feedback%2Fedge-middleware%2Ftree%2Fmain%2Fexamples%2Fip-blocking-datadome&env=NEXT_PUBLIC_DATADOME_CLIENT_KEY,DATADOME_SERVER_KEY,DATADOME_MANAGEMENT_KEY&project-name=ip-blocking-datadome&repository-name=ip-blocking-datadome){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/edge-middleware/ab-testing-simple ab-testing-simple
```

You\'ll need to have an account with
[DataDome](https://datadome.co/free-signup/){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}. Once
that\'s done, copy the `.env.example`{.inline_code__cgX1y
geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"} file in this directory to
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
(which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.example .env.local
```

Then open `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} and set the environment variables to match the ones
in your DataDome dashboard. Your keys should be available at
[https://app.datadome.co/dashboard/config/protection/keys](https://app.datadome.co/dashboard/config/protection/keys){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Deploy it to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=edge-middleware-eap){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).
:::

::: {.content_mcptgg__MGAfu test-id="templates/individual/content" style="overflow-wrap:break-word"}
## IP Blocking with Upstash {#ip-blocking-with-upstash-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This example features IP blocking at the edge with Redis using
[Upstash](https://upstash.com/){.link_link__hbWKh .link_highlight__kJZF9
rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

### Demo {#demo .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://edge-functions-ip-blocking.vercel.app](https://edge-functions-ip-blocking.vercel.app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fexamples%2Ftree%2Fmain%2Fedge-middleware%2Fapi-rate-limit-and-tokens&env=UPSTASH_REST_API_DOMAIN,UPSTASH_REST_API_TOKEN&project-name=ip-blocking&repository-name=ip-blocking){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/edge-middleware/ip-blocking ip-blocking
```

You\'ll need to have an account with
[Upstash](https://upstash.com/){.link_link__hbWKh .link_highlight__kJZF9
rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}. Once that\'s done, copy the
`.env.example`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} file in this directory to
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
(which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.example .env.local
```

Then open `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} and set the environment variables to match the REST
API of your database. It should look like this:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
UPSTASH_REST_API_DOMAIN = "us1-shiny-firefly-12345.upstash.io"
UPSTASH_REST_API_TOKEN = "your-api-token"
```

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Deploy it to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=edge-middleware-eap){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).
:::

## IP Blocking with Upstash {#ip-blocking-with-upstash-3 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

This example features IP blocking at the edge with Redis using
[Upstash](https://upstash.com/){.link_link__hbWKh .link_highlight__kJZF9
rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}.

### Demo {#demo-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

[https://edge-functions-ip-blocking.vercel.app](https://edge-functions-ip-blocking.vercel.app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

### How to Use {#how-to-use-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

You can choose from one of the following two methods to use this
repository:

#### One-Click Deploy {#one-click-deploy-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Deploy the example using
[Vercel](https://vercel.com?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}:

[](https://vercel.com/new/clone?repository-url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fvercel%2Fexamples%2Ftree%2Fmain%2Fedge-middleware%2Fapi-rate-limit-and-tokens&env=UPSTASH_REST_API_DOMAIN,UPSTASH_REST_API_TOKEN&project-name=ip-blocking&repository-name=ip-blocking){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}

#### Clone and Deploy {#clone-and-deploy-1 .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.25rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.020625rem;--text-weight:600"}

Execute [`create-next-app`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"}](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/packages/create-next-app){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} with
[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/installation){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"} to
bootstrap the example:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm create next-app --example https://github.com/vercel/examples/tree/main/edge-middleware/ip-blocking ip-blocking
```

You\'ll need to have an account with
[Upstash](https://upstash.com/){.link_link__hbWKh .link_highlight__kJZF9
rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}. Once that\'s done, copy the
`.env.example`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} file in this directory to
`.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
(which will be ignored by Git):

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
cp .env.example .env.local
```

Then open `.env.local`{.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code=""
data-version="v1"} and set the environment variables to match the REST
API of your database. It should look like this:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
UPSTASH_REST_API_DOMAIN = "us1-shiny-firefly-12345.upstash.io"
UPSTASH_REST_API_TOKEN = "your-api-token"
```

Next, run Next.js in development mode:

``` {.inline_code__cgX1y geist-inline-code="" data-version="v1"}
pnpm dev
```

Deploy it to the cloud with
[Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=github&utm_medium=readme&utm_campaign=edge-middleware-eap){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}
([Documentation](https://nextjs.org/docs/deployment){.link_link__hbWKh
.link_highlight__kJZF9 rel="nofollow" target="_blank" zone="null"}).
:::

::: {.content_mcptgg__MGAfu test-id="templates/individual/content" style="overflow-wrap:break-word"}
## Rate Limit API Requests {#rate-limit-api-requests .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:2rem;--text-line-height:2.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.049375rem;--text-weight:600"}

A firewall rule template designed to implement rate limiting for API
requests, helping to protect your API from abuse and ensure fair usage.

The rule defaults to the \"log action\". Set to \"Deny\" to actually
block requests.

### Consider customization {#consider-customization .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

The generated firewall rule provides a basic rate limiting structure.
Consider customizing the following parameters to suit your specific API
needs:

1.  Request limit: Adjust the maximum number of requests allowed within
    the time window.
2.  Time window: Modify the duration for which the request limit
    applies.
3.  Allow list: Configure exceptions for trusted entities across 15+
    parameters.
4.  Response: Customize the response sent when a client exceeds the rate
    limit.

### Availability {#availability .text_wrapper__i87JK .mdx-components_mdx-heading__HweOA data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--text-size:1.5rem;--text-line-height:2rem;--text-letter-spacing:-0.029375rem;--text-weight:600"}

Rate limiting is available to customers on Pro or Enterprise plans.
:::

### Vercel Web Application Firewall FAQs {#vercel-web-application-firewall-faqs .text_wrapper__i87JK data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-1000);--xs-text-size:1.5rem;--xs-text-line-height:2rem;--xs-text-weight:600;--xs-text-letter-spacing:-0.96px;--sm-text-size:1.5rem;--sm-text-line-height:2rem;--sm-text-weight:600;--sm-text-letter-spacing:-0.96px;--smd-text-size:2rem;--smd-text-line-height:2.5rem;--smd-text-weight:600;--smd-text-letter-spacing:-1.28px;--md-text-size:2rem;--md-text-line-height:2.5rem;--md-text-weight:600;--md-text-letter-spacing:-1.28px;--lg-text-size:2.5rem;--lg-text-line-height:3rem;--lg-text-weight:600;--lg-text-letter-spacing:-2.4px"}
