::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: {.grid_block__lyImu .faq_questions__z6oJb grid-cell="" style="--sm-grid-row:auto;--sm-grid-column:1/3;--lg-grid-column:2/4;--sm-cell-rows:auto;--sm-cell-columns:2;overflow:visible"}
What is Vercel Web Application Firewall?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Vercel's WAF is a customizable security tool that protects each
customer's web applications from various online threats and attacks,
it's part of the larger Vercel Firewall that acts as a system-wide
defense for all Vercel customers.
:::
::::

Is the WAF available for all Vercel plans?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Yes, the WAF is available for use on all plans.
:::
::::

How does Vercel's WAF work?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Vercel's WAF sits at the edge and applies its logic to all incoming
requests. Due to how the Vercel infrastructure is configured, a request
cannot bypass the Vercel Firewall or WAF once enabled. Rules are
evaluated against the incoming request in the order they are configured
and act according to any actions met.
:::
::::

What types of attacks does Vercel's WAF protect against?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
The Vercel WAF can be customized to a business's own priorities to stop
Layer 7/application layer attacks based on 15+ parameters like target
path, request path, headers, cookies, user agents, JA3/JA4 digests, and
more.

The system Vercel Firewall protects against Layer 3 attacks like DDoS
and SYN flood attacks, while managed rulesets help protect against OWASP
Top 10 risks like SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS).
:::
::::

Can the WAF be customized?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Yes, you can customize rules and policies to fit your specific security
needs.
:::
::::

Does the WAF provide logging and reporting?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Yes, it offers detailed logs and reports on security events and blocked
threats by visiting the Firewall tab within the dashboard. The Firewall
visibility is performed on a per-project basis and can link directly to
Monitoring queries that can be used to conduct deeper investigations.
:::
::::

Is the WAF compatible with all types of web applications?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
The WAF is embedded within the Vercel Edge Network and is therefore
designed to work with all web applications hosted on Vercel. Prior to
fulfilling any request, the WAF rules will be evaluated.
:::
::::

How do I enable the WAF for my Vercel project?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Go to your dashboard \> Project \> Firewall tab. For more information,
[read the
documentation](https://vercel.com/docs/security/vercel-waf/custom-rules#get-started).
:::
::::

Can I configure different rules for different projects?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Yes, you can set up different WAF configurations for each project.
:::
::::

Is it possible to block based on IP addresses?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Yes, you can configure WAF to block IP addresses in two ways: either via
the business logic of a custom firewall rule or by leveraging [WAF IP
Blocks](https://vercel.com/docs/security/vercel-waf/ip-blocking) which
performs IP denies even earlier in the request lifecycle.
:::
::::

How often should I update my WAF rules?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
It's recommended to review and update your rules regularly, especially
after significant changes to your application.
:::
::::

Does the WAF impact my application's performance?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
The WAF is embedded into the same request lifecycle flow of the Vercel
Edge Network and is designed to have minimal impact on performance while
providing robust security.
:::
::::

Can the WAF handle high-traffic websites?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Yes, it's built to scale and can handle high-traffic websites
efficiently.
:::
::::

How can I test if my WAF rules are working correctly?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Prior to publishing a WAF rule with an action that would affect users,
you can publish an active firewall rule with a "log" action which will
enable you to passively observe how the rule would affect traffic. Upon
evaluating the behavior of the rule, you can either further customize
them or update the rule with the intended action.
:::
::::

What happens if there's a false positive with my WAF rules?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
You can adjust your WAF rules to reduce false positives, you are in full
control of your WAF and changes propagate globally in around 300ms,
meaning any changes you publish will immediately reflect globally.
:::
::::

Is the WAF compatible with my custom domains?

::: {.stack_stack__iZkUS .stack .faq_chevron__UGjZY data-version="v1" style="--stack-flex:initial;--stack-direction:column;--stack-align:center;--stack-justify:center;--stack-padding:0px;--stack-gap:0px"}
![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)
:::

:::: faq_content__K9TiW
::: {.text_wrapper__i87JK .faq_answer__3LDUk data-version="v1" style="--text-color:var(--ds-gray-900);--text-size:1rem;--text-line-height:1.5rem;--text-letter-spacing:0px;--text-weight:400"}
Yes, it works with custom domains configured in your Vercel project.
:::
